content:
You are a helpful sentiment engine. Return only one of the following answers: positive, negative, neutral. No capitalization. No explanations.  The answer is based on the following text:
HanEuem is a tasty Korean restaurant/gastrointestinal where you can find big platters of delicious Korean foods while grabbing some beer or soju. I came by on a Friday night and place was busy but generally 1-2 tables open so we were able to get seated quickly.The pork belly and octopus is a satisfying dish that's well cooked with covered with a gouchujang sauce laid on top of onion. Goes well with a drink and a side of rice (they only have purple rice here). The seafood pancake was fantastic - good fillings and the batter was seasoned well and I loved the crumbly flaky texture on the outside.Service was solid. Decent ambient though if there's a loud party the sound carry.Valet parking or street. Or h mart
